description: Tool to decrypt/encrypt with Acéré. Acéré is a french cipher whose principle is to associate the letter A to the music note Ré (french music notation)

questions.answer: Acéré (A is Ré in French) encryption uses a substitution between notes and letters starting with the letter A for the note Ré hence the name of the code. Since there are not enough notes, usually the eighth notes ♪ (quavers) are used for the first letters and then the demi notes ● for the last letters. Example: A = Ré, B = Mi, ..., G = Do, H = Ré, ..., M = Si, N = Do, ... etc. Some variants allow to code digits starting from 0 = Ré = D.
questions.question: How to encrypt using Acéré cipher?

questions.answer: Acéré decryption requires knowing basic music theory/solfeggio like the type of music notes used before substitution (half notes, quarter notes, eighth notes). The remaining task is a replacement with the right letter.
